Other contraindications to LP include:
Underlying coagulation disorders with unexplained bleeding from mucous membranes, a petechial rash, expanding purpura or other features associated with disseminated intravascular coagulopathy [ 32]. Although a platelet count <100 × 10 9/L is used as a cut-off point, an LP may still be possible after careful consideration if the platelet count is 50 × 10 9/L [ 10]
Sepsis in the area of the LP site
Hemodynamic instability with shock and respiratory insufficiency [ 10, 32].
